Title: ProZilla: Multiple vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
ProZilla contains several buffer overflow vulnerabilities that can be
    exploited by a malicious server to execute arbitrary code with the rights
    of the user running ProZilla.

Background.Text: ProZilla is a download accelerator for Linux.

Description.Text: ProZilla contains several exploitable buffer overflows in the code handling the network protocols.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could setup a malicious server and entice a user to retrieve files from that server using ProZilla. This could lead to the execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the user running ProZilla.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text:
Currently, there is no released version of ProZilla that contains a fix
    for these issues. The original author did not respond to our queries,
    the code contains several other problems and more secure alternatives
    exist. Therefore, the ProZilla package has been hard-masked prior to
    complete removal from Portage, and current users are advised to unmerge
    the package.
